intro: Pimpinella corymbosa var. kotschyana, commonly known as the Kashmir white cumin, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small white or yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features include compound leaves and a taproot system, typical of many members of its family.
